DOC.brief_summary: This multi-center , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled study approximately 104 subject ( 52 per group ) evaluate effectiveness herb mineral combination product fast serum glucose level subject impair fast glucose . The study consist 5 visit : Screening visit , follow Baseline visit ( eligible subject randomize product consume throughout 12-week supplementation period ) , follow Supplementation period visit 3 , 6 12 week baseline .
DOC.brief_title: Trial Herb Mineral Combination Product Fasting Glucose Adults Risk Developing Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: The target population clinical trial otherwise healthy , pre-diabetic adult present impaired fasting glucose .
DOC.criteria: Be male female , least 18 year age If age ≥45 year , must body mass index ≥ 25 kg/m2 If age < 45 year , must body mass index ≥ 25 kg/m2 AND present least one additional risk factor develop diabetes . Agree use contraception throughout study period , unless postmenopausal surgically sterile ( woman ) Be able understand nature purpose study include potential risk side effect Be willing consent study participation comply study requirement Have finger stick fast blood glucose 105 140 mg/dL serum fast glucose 100 125 mg/dL , measure screening Have diabetes ( type I II ) HBA1c measurement > 6.5 % time past screen visit Have take within 2 week screen dietary supplement include vitamin mineral complex ; herbal supplement ; fish oil ; fiber supplement ; herbal ingredient/product significantly affect glucose metabolism Have take within 4 week screen prescription overthecounter ( OTC ) medication significantly affect glucose metabolism , include limited , sulfonylureas , meglitinides , biguanides , thiazolidinediones , alphaglucosidase inhibitor , Inhibitors dipeptidyl peptidase 4 ( DPP4 inhibitor ) , systemic corticosteroid Daily use nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDS ) ( daily baby aspirin use continuous use NSAIDS 3 day less acute ache pain acceptable ) Any comorbidity treatment could , opinion investigator , preclude subject 's ability successfully safely complete study may confound study outcomes Anticipated change dietary pattern physical activity level study , include attempt body weight reduction Eating disorder Polycystic ovary syndrome Known allergy intolerance substance study product Are pregnant breastfeed woman History alcohol , drug , medication abuse Have participate another study investigational product within 1 month screening Had recent ( < 3 month ) gastrointestinal surgery plan surgery clinical study
